```{r load-package, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(skimr)
```


```{r load-data}
train <- read_csv("data/train.csv")
```
```{r summary}
ncol(train)
nrow(train)
colnames(train)
skim(train)

```
```{r glimpse}
glimpse(train)
```
```{r}
train %>%
  na.omit() %>%
  summarize(across(everything(), min))

train %>%
  na.omit() %>%
  summarize(across(everything(), max))

train %>%
  select(patient_age) %>%
  arrange((patient_age))

train %>%
  count(patient_gender)
```


```{r split, eval=FALSE}
#set.seed()
#inTrain <- createDataPartition(y = train$treatment_pd, p=0.7, list=FALSE)
#training <- train[inTrain,]
#testing <- train[-inTrain,]
```

```{r scatter}
# patient age
ggplot(data = train, mapping = aes(x = patient_age, y = treatment_pd)) +
           geom_point()

# median income household for zip code
ggplot(data = train, mapping = aes(x = income_household_median, y = treatment_pd)) +
           geom_point()

# population for zip code
ggplot(data = train, mapping = aes(x = population, y = treatment_pd)) +
           geom_point()

# median age for zip code
ggplot(data = train, mapping = aes(x = age_median, y = treatment_pd)) +
           geom_point()

# unemployement rate for zip code
ggplot(data = train, mapping = aes(x = unemployment_rate, y = treatment_pd)) +
           geom_point()

# patient age for zip code 
ggplot(data = train, mapping = aes(x = patient_age, y = treatment_pd)) +
           geom_point()


```
